entries.title: In France, peak inflation is expected in early 2023
entries.description: According to the French national statistics bureau INSEE's forecast, the price hike should slowly decelerate to 5.5% by the middle of the year.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Palestine in the spotlight
entries.description: Until the semi-finals, the Moroccan team showed its support for the Palestinian cause, in unison with Arab supporters in Qatar and the rest of the world.

entries.title: Argentines erupt in joy after epic World Cup victory
entries.description: Argentina won the final against France on Sunday. Streets across the country became places of celebration in a country suffering from one of the world's highest inflation rates and where almost four residents in 10 live in poverty.

entries.title: Twitter bans linking to rival platforms including Facebook and Instagram
entries.description: It's the latest controversial move by Twitter's new owner Elon Musk to crack down on certain speech after he shut down accounts that he accused of 'doxxing' him.

entries.title: In France's Champagne region, a new wine sparkles without any bubbles
entries.description: The historic wines of France's Champagne vineyards were overshadowed by the queen of bubbles before finding a new lease on life and claiming their share of prestige.

entries.title: A cheap menu for Christmas
entries.description: Here are three chic and anti-waste recipes to please your guests on a budget.

entries.title: Argentina wins 2022 World Cup beating France 4-2 in a penalty shootout
entries.description: Lionel Messi finally won the biggest prize in soccer as Argentina beat France on Sunday in a thrilling final that finished 3-3 after extra time.

entries.title: 2022 World Cup: Argentina lead France 2-0 at halftime
entries.description: Messi and Di Maria put Argentina ahead of Les Bleus in the 2022 World Cup final at halftime.

entries.title: Political wrangling in Poland delays the payment of European funds
entries.description: Just when it looked like the end was in sight, the European Union put off the prospect of a first installment of the €35 billion in European Covid-19 stimulus funds after changes limiting Poland's judiciary independence.

entries.title: Argentina-France World Cup final starting line-ups
entries.description: Rabiot back for France, Di Maria starts for Argentina: the starting line-ups for the World Cup final between Argentina and France.

entries.title: Tunisia opposition calls for President Saied to quit after voters shun election
entries.description: Tunisia's parliamentary election board recorded just an 8.8% turnout.

entries.title: Falling in the polls and lacking a strategy, Donald Trump faces rough sailing
entries.description: The only candidate declared for the 2024 US presidential election is convincing just a third of Republicans.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: France and Argentina to face off for a third title
entries.description: Les Bleus will play against the Albiceleste in the World Cup final on Sunday. At stake is either a historic second victory in a row for France or a coronation for idol Lionel Messi.

entries.title: 'Our lives don't count': In Peru, deadly protests continue as new leader struggles for control
entries.description: Twenty people have been killed, mostly by gunfire, in protests demanding elections following the impeachment of former president Pedro Castillo.

entries.title: 2022 World Cup: With Messi and Mbappé in the final, PSG and Qatar have already won
entries.description: Two of Paris Saint-Germain's stars will face each other in the World Cup final between Argentina and France on Sunday.

entries.title: 2022 World Cup Final: When French presidents also come to play
entries.description: Emmanuel Macron will make an appearance at the World Cup final on Sunday, just like he did in 2018. It's proven a positive communication strategy for French presidents.

entries.title: Qatar says EU corruption investigation is threat to relations
entries.description: Four people are detained in Brussels as part of an investigation into suspected corruption benefitting Qatar, which had its access to the EU parliament suspended.

entries.title: Israel expels French-Palestinian lawyer Salah Hamouri
entries.description: Mr. Hamouri was accused of security offences and held without charge since March, under a controversial practice known as administrative detention.

entries.title: EU reaches deal on major carbon market reform
entries.description: The reform is due to end 'free allowances' to industries and targets fuel emissions from the building and road transport sectors.

entries.title: Marie Cau, France's first transgender mayor: 'My lie was a prison'
entries.description: In an interview with 'Le Monde', groundbreaker Marie Cau reflects on the painful discovery of her transidentity.

entries.title: Iran: 'The appalling spectacle of these killings marks a turning point in the repression'
entries.description: Following the executions of Iranian demonstrators, nearly a hundred artists and academics, including singer Yael Naim, philosopher Barbara Cassin and photographer Reza, in an op-ed in 'Le Monde,' are calling on France to reduce its diplomatic relations with the Islamic Republic of Iran 'to the bare minimum.'

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Facing France in final, Argentina's Lionel Messi is finally a prophet in his own land
entries.description: Often compared to Diego Maradona and perceived as a 'Catalan,' the captain of the Albiceleste, who is playing the final of the World Cup in Qatar on Sunday, is now unreservedly adored in Argentina.

entries.title: In Iran, public executions to terrorize protesters and quell the revolt
entries.description: Two men have been hanged and eleven people are on death row. The demonstrations have stopped.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Croatia, in third place, revels; Morocco leaves Qatar standing tall
entries.description: 'It's a bronze medal, but for us, it's like gold,' said Croatia's coach Zlatko Dalic. His team beat Morocco 2-1 in the playoff in Doha, on Saturday.

entries.title: Brazilian writer Nelida Pinon dies at 85
entries.description: Nelida Pinon joined the Brazilian Academy of Letters, in 1989. She died Saturday, December 18, in Lisbon.

entries.title: Tunisia: Most voters boycotted parliamentary election
entries.description: On Saturday, only 8.8 percent of the Tunisian electorate had cast votes. The new parliament will have virtually no authority following a power grab by President Kais Saied. Preliminary results are expected Monday.
